newsitem.title: ITALY: Lira parity crucial in return to ERM - Tietmeyer.
newsitem.headline: Lira parity crucial in return to ERM - Tietmeyer.

text.p: Bundesbank President Hans Tietmeyer said the German central bank would welcome the return of the Italian lira to Europe's exchange rate mechanism (ERM) if it agreed on the currency's parity.
Tietmeyer told a news conference at this lakeside Italian resort Italy had the right to decide for itself on whether to return to the ERM, which it left in a currency crisis in 1992.
"But before, there must be not only consultations but discussions and it is a common decision at what level (the lira should return). That's precisely the point," Tietmeyer said.

He said he did not want to interfere in discussions within Italy over an ERM return, saying only, "We would welcome Italy if we can agree on the basis, on the central parity. That is the crucial element."
The centre-left government of Italian Prime Minister Romano Prodi said shortly after it came to power earlier this year that it wanted to return the lira to the ERM in the course of 1996.
